RFate 0.0.1.9000
  • Reference

Create Namespace_constants parameter file for a FATE-HD simulation

Source: R/PRE_FATE.params_namespaceConstants.R

This script is designed to

PRE_FATE.params_namespaceConstants(name.simulation, global.abund.low,
  global.abund.med, global.abund.high, global.max.by.cohort,
  global.resource.thresh.med, global.resource.thresh.low)

Arguments

name.simulation

a string that corresponds to the main directory or simulation name of the FATE-HD simulation
global.abund.low

Not used for now. To be removed ?
global.abund.med

Not used for now. To be removed ?
global.abund.high

an integer in the order of 1 000 000 to rescale abundance values in each pixel
global.max.by.cohort

an integer in the order of 1 000 000 to rescale abundance values of each cohort in each pixel
global.resource.thresh.med

an integer in the order of 1 000 000 to convert PFG abundances in each strata into light resources. It corresponds to the limit of abundances above which light resources are medium. PFG abundances lower than this threshold imply high amount of light. Is is consequently lower than global.resource.thresh.low.
global.resource.thresh.low

an integer in the order of 1 000 000 to convert PFG abundances in each strata into light resources. It corresponds to the limit of abundances above which light resources are low. PFG abundances higher than global.resource.thresh.med and lower than this threshold imply medium amount of light.

Value

A .txt file into the name.simulation/DATA/NAMESPACE_CONSTANTS directory with the following parameters :

  • GLOBAL_LOW_ABUND

  • GLOBAL_MEDIUM_ABUND

  • GLOBAL_HIGH_ABUND

  • GLOBAL_MAX_BY_COHORT

  • GLOBAL_MEDIUM_RESOURCES_TRESH

  • GLOBAL_LOW_RESOURCES_TRESH

  • GLOBAL_FULL_SOIL_COVERAGE

Details

To get abundances
per PFG per pixel

  • per strata

  • for all strata

$$abund = 10 000 * totalAbund / \text{GLOBAL HIGH ABUND}$$

To transform PFG
abundances into
light resources

$$abund < \text{GLOBAL MEDIUM RESOURCES THRESH} \Leftrightarrow Light = High$$ $$abund > \text{GLOBAL MEDIUM RESOURCES THRESH } \& \\ abund < \text{GLOBAL LOW RESOURCES THRESH} \Leftrightarrow Light = Medium$$ $$abund > \text{GLOBAL LOW RESOURCES THRESH} \Leftrightarrow Light = Low$$

Examples


## Create a skeleton folder with the default name ('FATE_simulation')
PRE_FATE.skeletonDirectory()
#> 
#>  Your directory tree for your FATE-HD simulation ( FATE_simulation ) is ready!

## Create a Namespace_constants parameter file
PRE_FATE.params_namespaceConstants(name.simulation = "FATE_simulation"
                                   , global.abund.low = 1000000
                                   , global.abund.med = 5000000
                                   , global.abund.high = 8000000
                                   , global.max.by.cohort = 5000000
                                   , global.resource.thresh.med = 13000000
                                   , global.resource.thresh.low = 19000000)
#> 
#>  The parameter file  FATE_simulation/DATA/Namespace_constants.txt has been successfully created !
#>
